\textbf{The ''CMS Data Aggregation System'' (DAS):}
\begin{itemize}
\item uses simple structured queries
\item integrated access to heterogeneous services

\begin{itemize}
\item parse query \& contact services 
\item eliminates inconsistencies in responses:

\begin{itemize}
\item entity naming
\item data formats(XML, JSON)
\end{itemize}
\item combines the responses
\end{itemize}
\item requires only minimal service mappings

\begin{itemize}
\item no predefined schema \textrightarrow{} minimal effort in defining
services
\item complete services structure is figured out in runtime
\end{itemize}
\end{itemize}

\paragraph{Query language}

must specify an entity to be retrieved and filtering criteria (as
input to services). Optionally, the results could be 'piped' for further
filtering, sorting or aggregation (e.g. min, avg, count, etc), e.g.: 

\includegraphics[width=1\textwidth]{/home/vidma/DAS_paper/figures/DASQL_structure}
\end{document}
